body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E. Bramlett Govenor of Kentucky

The undersigned petitioners would respectfully represent that at the October term of the Lawrence Circuit Court 1865 Washingtin Chafin was convicted and Sentenced to the pentitentiary of Kentucky for one year before a charge of Grand Larceny, we would further represent that the said Washingtin Chaffin belongs to one of the oldest most numerous and respectable families of Lawrence County and that said Chaffin is a Young Man who has aside from dissipation sustained a good character at the time of the commission of the offence. the proof conduced to shew that he was drunk andwe therefore pray your Excellency to parden the said Chafin and permitt him to return home we believe that it will result greatly to the good of the prisoner -- and do no public injury

Peter Lawless
Jno, B, Hatcher
Laban T Moore
J H Allison S L C
F R Moore
Calvin Wellman
W. Shoemaker
Hiram. H. Tyler
J, D, Jones
A J Vinson C

From what information I have in in regard to this young mans case I am certain it is a case in which your Excellency not only has a good cause but that it is your duty to exercise clemency & pardon this case

Lawrence Cir Ct
vs
Washington Chafin
Grand Larceny
1 year
Oct term/65
Pardoned 21 Oct/65
